books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel about honor and injustice in the deep South through the eyes of a young girl.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that manipulates and controls its citizens.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A tale of wealth, love, and the American Dream during the Roaring Twenties.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A romantic novel of manners that follows the character development of Elizabeth Bennet.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A novel about a teenager's experiences in New York City after being expelled from prep school.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel García Márquez
books.description: A landmark novel that tells the multi-generational story of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

books.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: A book that explores the history of the human species from ancient evolution to the present.

books.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
books.author: Daniel Kahneman
books.description: An exploration of the two systems that drive the way we think and make choices.

books.title: Educated
books.author: Tara Westover
books.description: A memoir about a woman who was kept out of school as a child but went on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

books.title: The Power of Habit
books.author: Charles Duhigg
books.description: Explores how habits work and how they can be changed to transform our businesses, communities, and lives.

books.title: A Brief History of Time
books.author: Stephen Hawking
books.description: A book about the structure, origin, development and eventual fate of the universe.

books.title: The Gene: An Intimate History
books.author: Siddhartha Mukherjee
books.description: A magnificent history of the gene and a response to the defining question of the future: What becomes of being human when we learn to 'read' and 'write' our own genetic information?

books.title: Cosmos
books.author: Carl Sagan
books.description: Explores the mutual development of science and civilization, tracing the evolution of the cosmos and discussing the cosmos's fifteen-billion-year journey.

books.title: Silent Spring
books.author: Rachel Carson
books.description: Documents the adverse environmental effects caused by the indiscriminate use of pesticides.

books.title: The Diary of a Young Girl
books.author: Anne Frank
books.description: The diary kept by Anne Frank while she was in hiding for two years with her family during the Nazi occupation of the Netherlands.

books.title: Guns, Germs, and Steel
books.author: Jared Diamond
books.description: Examines why some societies have advanced technologically and grew while others have not.

books.title: The Wright Brothers
books.author: David McCullough
books.description: Chronicles the dramatic story of the Wright brothers' journey to achieve powered flight.

books.title: SPQR: A History of Ancient Rome
books.author: Mary Beard
books.description: A fresh look at Roman history from one of the world's foremost classicists.

books.title: Steve Jobs
books.author: Walter Isaacson
books.description: The biography of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs.

books.title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
books.author: Rebecca Skloot
books.description: Tells the story of Henrietta Lacks, a poor tobacco farmer whose cells were taken without her knowledge and became one of the most important tools in medicine.

books.title: Becoming
books.author: Michelle Obama
books.description: The memoir of former United States First Lady Michelle Obama.

books.title: Leonardo da Vinci
books.author: Walter Isaacson
books.description: A biography of the Italian Renaissance polymath that connects his art to his science.

books.title: Clean Code
books.author: Robert C. Martin
books.description: A handbook of agile software craftsmanship.

books.title: The Innovators
books.author: Walter Isaacson
books.description: How a group of hackers, geniuses, and geeks created the digital revolution.

books.title: Algorithms to Live By
books.author: Brian Christian & Tom Griffiths
books.description: How computer algorithms can be applied to our everyday lives, helping to solve common decision-making problems.

books.title: Hooked
books.author: Nir Eyal
books.description: How to build habit-forming products through the Hook Model: a four-step process companies use to build customer habits.
